thread.title: ‘Bias much?’ Different tone spotted in headlines about Obama & Trump’s handling of US attorneys
thread.title_full: ‘Bias much?’ Different tone spotted in headlines about Obama & Trump’s handling of US attorneys

author: Doug P.
title: ‘Bias much?’ Different tone spotted in headlines about Obama & Trump’s handling of US attorneys
text:
‘Bias much?’ Different tone spotted in headlines about Obama & Trump’s handling of US attorneys Posted at 2:02 pm on March 11, 2017 by Doug P. 
As we reported last night, President Donald Trump told 46 U.S. Obama-era attorneys to resign . Such moves are not unusual for incoming presidents, but similar stories do get reported differently: Trump “ousts” US Attorneys. Obama “replaces” them. pic.twitter.com/JNbvmEQLBj 
— Jay Caruso (@JayCaruso) March 11, 2017 
What a difference one word can make. LOL same author too! 
— Nathan Wurtzel (@NathanWurtzel) March 11, 2017 same author even, this time https://t.co/F3m4as1TJN 
— JJ Ⓐ「citizenfive」☠ (@Ctzn5) March 11, 2017 Trending 
Other media outlets are giving the impression that such a move by the Trump administration is unprecedented, which isn’t the case. And Clinton fired ALL of them https://t.co/qkp4cGgnU4 
— Pave Darkest (@LegOfTruth) March 11, 2017 This is why the MSM isn't to be trusted. They have a liberal agenda, they just try to hide it from us. https://t.co/AyndDCKslM 
— Chris Antenucci (@chrisantenucci) March 11, 2017 Every. Single. Time. https://t.co/Q2jNdzktft 
— (((Fusilli Spock))) (@awstar11) March 11, 2017 Media bias much? https://t.co/mZygIfs9VB
